page.title: 01INTRODUCTION
page.content: The survey area is an attractive land of partly wooded hills and valleys crossed by narrow lanes bordered by tall hedges. The River Asker flows west towards Bridport in the southern part of the area, and the Mangerton River flows south near the western boundary. The Asker joins the Brit which flows to the sea at West Bay. The area is predominantly farmland with scattered clusters of houses. The picturesque village of Loders contains many old thatched cottages and some new building. In recent years the traditional farming population has declined and many houses have become holiday cottages, retirement homes and homes for business and professional people commuting to Dorchester and Weymouth.
